alert.note: Alert for Central and Southern Valley; Dawson; Eastern Roosevelt; Garfield; McCone; Richland; Western Roosevelt (Montana) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued May 29 at 3:36PM MDT by NWS Glasgow
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northeastern Garfield, central Roosevelt, southeastern Valley, southern Sheridan, McCone, northwestern Dawson and northwestern Richland Counties through 430 PM MDT... At 336 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southeast of Bredette to 10 miles east of Wolf Point to 6 miles south of The Pines Rec Area. Movement was east at 20 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Wolf Point, Poplar, Culbertson, Brockton, Froid, The Pines Rec Area, Frazer, Flowing Wells Rest Area, Vida, Nelson Creek Rec Area, Rock Creek Rec Area, Oswego, Fort Kipp, Sprole, Haxby and Weldon. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. If on or near Fort Peck Lake, get out of the water and move indoors or inside a vehicle. Remember, lightning can strike out to 10 miles from the parent thunderstorm. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Move to safe shelter now! Do not be caught on the water in a thunderstorm.

area.areaDesc: Central and Southern Valley; Dawson; Eastern Roosevelt; Garfield; McCone; Richland; Western Roosevelt
